update

public void update(Object value,
                   Context context)

After the object is originally get or set, this method can be called to update the value. This method should only work if the set(Object, String[], Context) or get(Object, Context) method was called first.

NOTE: Accessors are not thread safe and need not be because a new one is created for each atom.

Parameters:
value - The value to update the accessor with.
context - The current context.

getMemberAccessor

public abstract MemberAccessor getMemberAccessor()
Returns:
Returns the member accessor that is closest to the current atom in the expression. If the current atom is a member, this should just return this. If the current atom is a collection for example, this would return the member that the collection was retrieved from.

createValue

protected Object createValue(Object key,
                             Context context)
Creates a new instance of the current type.

Parameters:
key - This is only used when creating arrays. It is the next atom, which is always the size of the array.
context - The current context.
Returns:
The new value.

convert

protected Object convert(String[] values,
                         Context context,
                         Field field)
                  throws ConversionException
Converts the given value parameter (parameter) to a type that is accepted by the set method of this property. This method attempts to convert the value regardless of the value being null. However, this method short circuits and returns the value unchanged if value is runtime assignable to the type of this BaseBeanProperty.

Parameters:
values - The String values to convert.
context - The current context.
field - The field that the conversion is occurring for. This is used to look for conversion annotations.
Returns:
The value parameter converted to the correct type.
Throws:
ConversionException - If there was a problem converting the parameter.

toString

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object
